instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A shorted <SIGNAL>EDP_INT_AUX_N</SIGNAL>. CPU replacing possible?
threads.message:
I have this board from a macbook with flexgate (disturbed picture). Customer continued working with it till it gave no picture anymore.
<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_AUX_N</SIGNAL> 20 ohms to ground with everything disconnected. External display works, so definitely a defective CPU.

I have also a donor board from exactly the same macbook, also (I hope) a 2,9GHz i5 from 2016. This had a burnt <CAPACITOR>C7901</CAPACITOR> (<SIGNAL>PPBUS_HS_CPU</SIGNAL>), which literally burnt a hole in the board. Normally this CPU should be fine.
But it's a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-[I]09[/I] board.

On the CPU of the donor board, I can read two numbers: J619B764SR2JK (horizontally) and 00014 (vertically)
The target board's CPU is listed with J625C284SR2JK (horizontally) and 05621 (vertically)
I don't have experience with this Intel numbers. Are that serial numbers, date codes or partnumbers :unsure:

Should it be possible to place the CPU of the donor board to the target board?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A shorted <SIGNAL>EDP_INT_AUX_N</SIGNAL>. CPU replacing possible?
threads.message:
SR2JK is the CPU model.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.cpu-world.com/sspec/SR/SR2JK.html[/URL]
The other mentioned numbers should be lot code.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A shorted <SIGNAL>EDP_INT_AUX_N</SIGNAL>. CPU replacing possible?
threads.message: Good news, this replacement should work. Thanks for the link!
